name: FIWARE Identity Management - Keyrock
description: OAuth 2.0-based authentication of users and devices, user profile management, Single Sign-On (SSO) and Identity Federation across multiple administration domains.
sites_https_justification: The project website and repo use GitHub, which supports HTTPS using TLS. There's no separate download URL (use git to download from the repo).
contribution_justification: https://github.com/ging/fiware-idm/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
license_location_justification: It's in the LICENSE file in the top level directory. See: https://github.com/ging/fiware-idm/blob/master/LICENSE
floss_license_justification: The MIT, Apache 2.0 license is widely acknowledged as being OSS. The license is at https:/github.com/ging/fiware-idm/blob/master/LICENSE The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The MIT license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: The directory "doc" contains most documentation. Installation information is at https:/github.com/ging/fiware-idm/tree/master/doc/installation_and_administration_guide and other materials are at https:/github.com/ging/fiware-idm/tree/master/doc/
repo_public_justification: It uses git, URL is https://github.com/ging/fiware-idm
repo_track_justification: Uses git to track this. Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_interim_justification: Interim versions are put on git, not just final versions.
repo_distributed_justification: Uses git. Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification: The primary development team uses git commit records to identify releases. Regular umbrella releases aligned with the FIWARE Foundation.
version_tags_justification: Full releases are tagged using 'git tag'.
release_notes_justification: Release notes are in each release information textbox. See https://github.com/ging/fiware-idm/releases
report_process_justification: Yes, either GitHub issue tracker. See: https://github.com/ging/fiware-idm/blob/master/README.md
report_responses_justification: Yes. This is a requirement for membership of the FIWARE Foundation Catalogue
enhancement_responses_justification: The project has been responding to most enhancement requests.
report_archive_justification: Yes, via GitHub issue tracker: https://github.com/ging/fiware-idm/issues
vulnerability_report_response_justificat: No external reports so far, so this is vacuously true.
build_justification: The software is written using JavaScript, Node.js and their implementations run directly on the source code.
test_justification: Yes, it includes a test suite based on Mocha
test_invocation_justification: Yes. "npm test" invokes the automated test suite. This is documented in the README.md
test_most_justification: Met. Currently coverage of the codebase is well over 70%.
test_policy_justification: Yes. The CONTRIBUTING file at https://github.com/ging/fiware-idm/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md says, "Please ensure that your contribution passes all tests". Also, the README shows the test coverage, which encourages adding tests as new functionality is added.
tests_are_added_justification: Tests are added as new functionality is added.
tests_documented_added_justification: Yes. The CONTRIBUTING file at https://github.com/ging/fiware-idm/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md says, "Please ensure that your contribution passes all tests".
warnings_justification:
The set of tools used for examining code quality are listed in CONTRIBUTING.md.
The project uses eslint is used to look for problems in Javascript. The markdown documentation is scanned with remark and textlint. Docker files are scanned with Hadolint.
warnings_fixed_justification: In general warnings are addressed. In some cases warnings are disabled for specific cases.
warnings_strict_justification: The settings for the warning tools are generally fairly strict.
know_secure_design_justification: Álvaro Alonso assumes overall responsibility for this along with the development team.
know_common_errors_justification: Álvaro Alonso assumes overall responsibility for this along with the development team. For a discussion of security requirements, common types of security vulnerabilities, and how this application counters those common kinds of vulnerabilities, see: https://github.com/ging/fiware-idm/blob/master/doc
crypto_published_justification: The software uses bcrypt to store salted hashed iterated passwords, and https+standard crypto protocols to communicate with users.
crypto_call_justification: Uses 'bcrypt' package for bcrypt, and https implementation built into its web server.
crypto_floss_justification: All required functionality is implemented using FLOSS, including cryptography.
crypto_keylength_justification: Note: This application uses bcrypt, which uses 128-bit salt and produces 184 bits as a salted encrypted iterated hash. This is less than 224 bits, but that's not really what the 224 bits of hash are for. This probably needs clarification in the criteria; see https://github.com/ging/fiware-idm/issues/153
crypto_working_justification: The only cryptographic algorithm directly used by the program is bcrypt, which is not broken.
crypto_pfs_justification: Nothing in the code inhibits or prevents the use of PFS; that is a property of the website's web server.
crypto_password_storage_justification: Bcrypt used for storing local passwords.
crypto_random_justification: The nonce for the salt is created by the bcrypt package; its code shows that it uses OpenSSL to get cryptographically random data for the salt. Other nonces are part of the https implementation, which are implemented by the web server (not this application).
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: No such vulnerabilities at this time.
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: No such vulnerabilities at this time.
static_analysis_justification: As noted in https://github.com/ging/fiware-idm/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md, eslint is used to analyze the Javascript client-side code is analyzed with ESLint, using over 100 rules. These analysis tools are used as part of the default ‘npm test’ process used in local development, as well as the continuous integration server running on Travis CI
static_analysis_common_vulnerabilities_j: eslint specifically looks for common vulnerabilities in JavaScript applications.
static_analysis_fixed_justification: This is vacuously true, since we've had no reports of vulnerabilities that apply to a deployed system.
static_analysis_often_justification: All commits to GitHub are run through Travis, which performs a number of static analysis checks (eslint, hadolint, etc.).
dynamic_analysis_justification: Dynamic code analysis has not been applied
dynamic_analysis_unsafe_justification: Application written using Javascript, not C/C++
dynamic_analysis_enable_assertions_justi: Instead of embedding run-time assertions, there are many external tests with assertions that are checked during automated testing.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: No issues were found by dynamic analysis.
crypto_weaknesses_justification: The only cryptography used directly by this application is bcrypt (used for storing passwords as salted iterated hashes). At the time of this writing, no serious breaks are known in bcrypt. The application also depends on the web server's https configuration, but that is out of scope for this code.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: Code is frequently integrated back into GitHub; Travis and several other tools are then run on the result to determine if there's a problem. If a problem is found, the tools provide feedback via GitHub. For more information, see the BadgeApp's status on Travis.
discussion_justification: GitHub issue tracker and pull requests support discussion
no_leaked_credentials_justification: No valid private credentials are leaked. Usernames and Passwords may be entered using Docker secrets and ENVs
english_justification: All documentation is in English, and the project accepts bug reports and comments in English.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
implementation_languages: JavaScript, SCSS, API Blueprint, Dockerfile, Shell

name: SpiNNFrontEndCommon
description: Common support code for user-facing front end systems.
contribution_justification: Projects on GitHub by default use issues and pull requests, as encouraged by documentation such as <https://guides.github.com/activities/contributing-to-open-source/>.
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/SpiNNakerManchester/SpiNNFrontEndCommon/blob/master/LICENSE.md>.
floss_license_justification: every file has a copywrite and licance bit at the top. every repo has a licence.md describing the gpl license.   The GPL-3.0-only license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The GPL-3.0-only license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: Some documentation basics file contents found.
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
version_unique_justification: we actively make a unique release number every time we make a formal release.
report_process_justification: issue tracker on github and spinnaker user mailing list at https://groups.google.com/g/spinnakerusers
report_responses_justification: we ack issues within 24hs on both github and spinnaker users group.
enhancement_responses_justification: its usually the team doing the enhancements and so respond to their own issues accordingly. the spinnaker user group has a 24h turn around for responses.
report_archive_justification: github issues are achieved and the google user group topics are also kept active.
build_justification: we have scripts for compiling the c code, but releases have pre-compiled src code. the python does not need compiling and is installed via pip.
build_floss_tools_justification: assumed make and pip are floss tools.
test_justification: we have a unit tests that is ran by github actions and jenkins CI suite which is available on github.
test_invocation_justification: jenkins and gitup actions are standard.
test_most_justification: we use coverage to check this, but we believe they cover the majority of the use cases for the repo.
test_policy_justification: new functionality needs to go through a pull request that is not tested by the current integration tests are expected to include new tests.
warnings_justification: use numerious linters and code quality software checkers. pylint for example.
warnings_fixed_justification: they dont get past a pull request if there are warnings.
warnings_strict_justification: they are turned on by default.
know_common_errors_justification: 2 of the main software team know common errors in the python and the spinnaker architecture.
delivery_mitm_justification: github and pip supports https and thus supports this.
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: when we know of them. we do.
static_analysis_justification: pep8 and pylint for the python.
static_analysis_fixed_justification: any vulnerability would be fixed in the next pull request.
static_analysis_often_justification: every commit on every open pull request. daily on the main branch.
dynamic_analysis_fixed_justification: when we find out about them we do fix them in a timely manner.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: jenkins and github actions are ran on every open pull request and we have a nightly run for more complex integration tests.
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
no_leaked_credentials_justification: we keep those private things in a more secure location away from the code.
english_justification: all our read the docs is published in English
hardened_site_justification: Found all required security hardening headers.

name: Arbor
description: The Arbor multi-compartment neural network simulation library.
contribution_justification: Non-trivial contribution file in repository: <https://github.com/arbor-sim/arbor/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md>.
contribution_requirements_justification:
Direct link: https://github.com/arbor-sim/arbor/wiki/How-to-contribute
It is linked in CONTRIBUTING
license_location_justification: Non-trivial license location file in repository: <https://github.com/arbor-sim/arbor/blob/master/LICENSE>.
floss_license_justification: The BSD-3-Clause license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
floss_license_osi_justification: The BSD-3-Clause license is approved by the Open Source Initiative (OSI).
documentation_basics_justification: Some documentation basics file contents found.
repo_public_justification: Repository on GitHub, which provides public git repositories with URLs.
repo_track_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git can track the changes, who made them, and when they were made.
repo_distributed_justification: Repository on GitHub, which uses git. git is distributed.
release_notes_justification: They're not kept in a file, but as part of the Github Release feature: https://github.com/arbor-sim/arbor/releases
release_notes_vulns_justification: I don't think we've ever considered security, even though the software supports network communication (through MPI). Neuroscientific simulation software seems far removed from such considerations, but maybe that is our mistake.
vulnerability_report_process_justificati:
https://github.com/arbor-sim/arbor/issues
Our issue tracker is open to any kind of issue, including reporting security issues. The nature of the project (biological neural network simulator for academic research)  is such that I don't think this is very relevant.
test_policy_justification: We request it for each PR.
tests_are_added_justification: We don't ship without a 100% score on our tests.
crypto_published_justification: Considering the nature of the project, we have no reason to incorporate any cryptographic functionality.
vulnerabilities_fixed_60_days_justificat: We have no such reported vulns.
vulnerabilities_critical_fixed_justifica: If we had any, we would certainly try!
dynamic_analysis_justification: We have a unit test suite that can be built with the `tests` target.
test_continuous_integration_justificatio: We're about to switch to using Github Actions: https://github.com/arbor-sim/arbor/pull/1249
discussion_justification: GitHub supports discussions on issues and pull requests.
hardened_site_justification: // X-Content-Type-Options was not set to "nosniff".
